medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient, an 8-year-old boy, presented with moderate hypothyroidism and abnormal thyroid function tests.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred to the pediatrician for evaluation of abnormal thyroid function at the age of 8. He did not present symptoms of hypothyroidism; however, hormonal tests revealed mild hypothyroidism. Retrospectively, he had displayed subtle hypothyroidism and hyperthyrotropinemia at 6 years of age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a homozygous missense mutation (I131T) in the TRHR gene, leading to central congenital hypothyroidism. He was overweight (BMI: 20.4 kg/m2), but his stature was normal.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother, two brothers, and grandmother were heterozygous for the mutation, exhibiting isolated hyperthyrotropinemia (TSH: 4.3 to 8 mIU/L).
